name: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked with the hotel chain directly and got a great deal for a 5 night stay.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We upgraded to the Executive floor (top 2 floors of the hotel) where we had a fab view and could even see the Harbour Bridge from the balcony!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in the Executive Lounge and drinks were free in the evening until 7pm!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was immaculate; staff were very friendly and best of all - the location was superb.
reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for

likes.disliked: — the TV reception & the too high pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The room was lovely - bathroom was great - large separate bath, walk in shower. The hotel's buffet breakfast is a shocker. Coffee is awful and staff aren't generous with refills. The cafe over the road on the corner was the best place for an easy meal. The beds are extremely hard - but I suspect that suits the Asian market who seem to like their beds to be firm? Pool is an indoor lap pool on the 1st floor. On the whole, I'd probably not stay there again as there are other places to try next time. It wasn't good enough to want to use it regularly.
reviews.title: Really enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at the Radisson Plaza for 3 nights in 2005 and it is still the best hotel we have stayed in before or since.
reviews.title: Still the best hotel to date

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was beautiful, very tastefully decorated and although not on the roomy side there was space for two comfortable easy chairs. The bed was very comfortable, actually the pillow was so wonderful that I went out and bought the same one as soon as we got home. The bathroom was clean and luxurious - we especially loved the tv view from the spa. Staff were unfailingly polite, courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Great value hotel

likes.liked: — Amazing standard of restaurants, prime location, great value for a 5* quality hotel
likes.disliked: — Lack of views is a let down in a city as amazing as Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All this and a beautiful, heritage building too...
reviews.title: Nice facilities, lost points on service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Radisson Plaza in Sydney is very well-located for all CBD activities. I was impressed by the high quality facilities, top notch service and outstanding restaurants.
reviews.title: Best location in CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GREAT THINGS:
reviews.title: Great central location

likes.liked: — The fabulously firm bed and the view from balcony
likes.disliked: — Feeling guilty about using the bath with a drought on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would expect better from such a hotel.
reviews.title: Just Perfect
Great Staff
reviews.text: The Radisson Plaza Hotel was a great hotel. Less than 200 m from the Wynyard train station and less than a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay. Many restaurants are located near the hotel. You could not beat the location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: When the temperature in Sydney soars past 40 degrees Celsius, I cool myself by checking into a nice local hotel. This summer, I chose to stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel. It's a great location for people who want to be in smack bang Sydney's Central Business District and is a short 3 minute walk to Wynyard Train Station and Circular Quay. Within 10 minutes, you'll be able to saunter to into the magnificent Sydney Opera House and the Museum of Contemporary Art. It's also just a short walk from the shops at Pitt Street Mall and those hip Merivale Restaurants on George Street and Ash Street. If you want food that's quick and good value for money, just cross Pitt Street immediately opposite the hotel to the food court at Australia Square where local workers dine on weekdays. Also at Australia Square (on Level 47) is O Bar and Dining, a revolving restaurant, where we enjoyed a fine dinner with views over Sydney in twinkling lights.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed in an Atrium room which I found to be spacious, clean and comfortable (and surprisingly quiet, given it was only one floor above ground level). The swimming pool with glass ceiling provided welcome relief from the heat outside. Check-in and check-out went smoothly and breakfast featured a wide array of hot and cold foods. My dish of eggs benedict was cooked to perfection.
reviews.title: What a wonderful experiance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Yes, I'm tempted to return even if the temperature does not reach 40 degrees C and even though I'm a Sydneysider who lives nearby.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently My wife and I and my 4 year old daughter stayed at the Radisson Blu hotel in Sydney, We stayed 2 nights. From the moment we were greeted by the staff at the front door the customer service level was outstanding, The room was spacious and very well appointed. Being in such an ideal location made the day trips easy. Breakfast both mornings at the Bistro Fax left me wishing I could eat more I left very full and very satisfied. We made use of the pool, spa and steam rooms which were all very clean. Room service was outstanding and very efficient in delivering to the room. Should you wish to stay in one night as we did, the movie list is endless with all the popular titles for everyone in the family. By the end of the two nights we didn't wan to leave to go home and will defiantly be back.
reviews.title: Central luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location and facilities - including gym and pool. Rooms were large, comfortable, clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I have just returned from an evening at the Radisson and it was most enjoyable. The hotel itself is lovely and the rooms are excellent. Nothing is too hard for the staff.
reviews.title: A lovely night

likes.liked: — The can do attitude of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is valet car parking and we were pleasantly informed that even though we were checking out on the saturday morning we could still take our car in and out of the valet parking until midnight that night! This meant we could go for a wander and then park the car while we did some stuff in the city.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was a good size (Atrium room) and while it didn't have a view we weren't concerned as you really don't spend any time in your room anyway. The bathroom was huge, the only slight issue was that the shower kept facing the wall but we were able to wrap the cord on the shower head around pole and that helped it point into the middle of the shower.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Food wise the only downside was that the scrambled eggs appeared to be powdered. There is a chef that prepares eggs to your liking on the day so next time we will just go with that.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a most enjoyable evening. We will most definately be back!
reviews.title: Loved the Radisson Plaza! Believe the hype!

likes.liked: — Very personal service. Great inclusions with the room rate.
likes.disliked: — The weird bath setup in the bathroom. How are you supposed to get in it?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in the heart of the city, clean rooms and friendly, efficient staff. Because our room wasn't ready we were upgraded to a superior room which was comfortable and adequate but not large with all the amenities required. The pool was small but gym and steam room were good. We would stay again
reviews.title: great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel right in the heart of the city. The room on the first floor was very comfortable and even on Monday morning was not at all noisy.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Both check in and check out were effortless and all staff were very helpful especially the doormen who were a great source of local information.
reviews.title: Sydney trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are plenty of good cafes and restaurants around the hotel, we had a great meal at the Chop House, and you are in walking distance of both Sydney and Daling Harbour.
reviews.title: A fantastic experience with awesome staff!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Hotel is in the perfect location, only 10 minutes walk from circular key on one side and shopping malls on the opposite side. Jamie’s Italian restaurant is next door, but the price you pay to stay in this hotel is too high for what you really get, one of the main reasons for our disappointment with the hotel was that we had to call housekeeping every day to come and clean our room and set up our beds which should be part of the regular routine. Bottle of water which we had as complimentary gift in Singapore was $7. Room size is ok but nothing special, keep in mind that you are paying over $380 per room; luckily we had corporate rates which brought the price down to $230. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is not included in the price which is $30 + pp, there is nice coffee shop next door with much more reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Excellent top notch hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel and were pleased with an efficient check-in with friendly staff. The hotel reception was immaculate as was the bathrooms.
reviews.title: Stylish, Clean and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the spa suite and the room did not disappoint. The bed was ENORMOUS and comfortable with quality sheets. The one problem we encountered was the spa jets not working which was a bit of a disappointment.
reviews.title: Solid hotel
the best hotel ever
reviews.text: The breakfast standard was a little lower than other 5 star hotels I've stayed at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was a satisfying stay and what you would expect for the price.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is pretty swish, probably what you would expect. Got a good w/e rate as place is in business district, so area is a bit dead but really well located to get to other areas easily and fast. Good service, very nicely styled and clean room which was a good size. Like most hotels of this calibre, the extras eg internet were an absolute rip off though.
reviews.title: A belated review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Trailfinders after reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Excellent Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very impressed with the location, being only a short walk to Circular Quay, The Opera House and The Harbour Bridge.
reviews.title: A treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wallked most nights to Darling Harbour which we found better than Circular Quay and The Rocks. It was a little bit further but the weather was nice so we didnt mind.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

likes.liked: — The funky window between the bathroom and the bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff were very helpful and the room service was excellent for ordering food and for making your room every day.
reviews.title: Rethink the Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rooms were modern, very clean and very comfortable giving that home from home feeling.
reviews.title: The Radisson was brilliant!

likes.liked: — Location - walking distance to all the major sites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary at the Radisson Plaza. Our weekend was made extra special by the wonderful, friendly staff members there. Starting at check in we were upgraded to a Plaza Club room on the 10th floor by a very helpful young lady (we had already booked an 'Indulge in the City' rate which gave us access to the Plaza Club lounge). The concierge and the young man who brought up our luggage couldn't have done more for us.
reviews.title: Celebratory Weekend a great success at the Radisson Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Access to the Club lounge proved to be one of the highlights of our stay, especially the breakfast which had a great selection and included lots of fresh fruit, yoghurts and pastries and a delicious mix of 4 hot options (different choice the next day), as well as the usual cereals, juice, toast etc and good espresso coffee. The Plaza Club staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help, bringing coffee and toast and even arranging with housekeeping to change our doona for a blanket, they really made us feel at home. Canapes served each evening in the Club lounge with a glass of sparkling (or wine, beer etc) also put us into celebratory mood and solved our problem of needing a quick snack before leaving for the Opera one night.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in Excellent Location - but breakfast prices are exhorbitant.

likes.liked: — Excellent Service and Location, reasonabl;e price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was lovely with the most comfortable hotel bed and pillows I think we've ever had. Decor was elegant, marble floored bathroom had a full length bath and separate shower. Only negative was - we would have loved a second armchair. There were two chairs but the other was a padded desk chair which belonged to the handy business desk.
reviews.title: Faultless and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On leaving we were able to store our luggage for as long as we needed and when we collected it the helpful doorman not only lifted the cases down the stairs but gave us full instructions for the next leg of our trip. Full marks to the professional and ultra friendly staff who made our stay so welcoming, we look forward to returning in the future.
reviews.title: Absolutely Terrific!!

likes.liked: — Cocktail Hour! Gym, room, service, turndown, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Radisson Plaza in the heart of Sydney's CBD was a great place to stay on a weekend visit to Sydney. The location, just a short stroll from the Central Quai and a few blocks from the George Street Shops and the touristy Darling Harbour, was ideal for pedestrian travellers. It will be our first choice on a return visit to the city.
reviews.title: 10th stay and still great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here in late March. We had just arrived off a cruise ship and we were given a room right away! This was a welcome plus.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to unpack and start our exploring. What a wonderful city to walk in. We walked everwhere we needed to go. Darling Harbour and Paddys Markets are a good hike but while taking in the sights along the way it did not seem to long. The breakfast was one of the better we have had at a hotel buffet. Only complaint was that they just need to cook the bacon longer. It was very,very under cooked. Noticed a lot was left on peoples plates. What a waste! The room was great, loved the tub plus a shower aspect. Everyone very friendly in reception and front door areas. This hotel is so close to the Quay area it make for easy access to ferries, Botanical Gardens, Opera House, The Rocks, etc,etc. Would highly recomend this hotel if visiting Sydney.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Central Location to anything in the Sydney CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked this hotel from a mystery deal from lastminute.com.The hotel has a modern feel while celebrating its history and location. We couldn't fault the service or the quality of the facilities. Rooms were modern, spacious, clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The aforementioned mystery deal got us an Atrium Room, an internal room which was a little disappointing. We decided or were persuade, can't decide which, to upgrade to a business class room with a view. This also allowed access to the lounge, for drinks and canapes. It was quite nice but in hindsight probably not great value for us or essential to the experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location for sightseeing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast was pretty good quality with lots of choice and lovely ambiance.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a four night stay and were really pleased with the hotel. We booked on www.wotif.com and got a really good deal ( bearing in mind it was Australia Day weekend).
reviews.title: A comfortable friendly, very central hotel close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in a quiet street about a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and pretty much all the central tourist sites. Its convenient for all the CBD Hire car offcies too - which are an easy walk away through the park.Our room and bathroom was modern and comfortable and the only niggle was that the TV was pretty low rent but as we didnt really use it - not a problem.If you have kids to entertain in the early evening you might want to check up on this when you book. Broadband is available in the room for $24 per 24 hours and wifi at the same price is available in the lobby. Breakfast was more than adequate and service was really quick. The gym and indoor pool were good too but a tad small - but note the pool is really for adults wanting to exercise rather than a place to take the kids to unwind after a big day sight seeing. We would definitely consider it again when we next visit Sydney.
reviews.title: Safe choice but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a really friendly hotel
reviews.title: Spot-On!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 4 nights in the Radisson Plaza after combing through many reviews on TripAdvisor and making our choice. We are frequent travellers worldwide and these are our impressions.
reviews.title: Good experience at the Rad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: The pros:
reviews.title: Good without being exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is good tor Circular Quay and The Rocks but the hotel lacks any views from the rooms or dining room. However, the room was good and staff were very helpful. We needed an extra bed at short notice and although we had to pay an extra $60 per night it was quickly sorted for us. The breakfast is excellent with a good choice of hot and cold food. Indoor pool was pleasant and relaxing after a day walking around the city.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my husband and 2 children. Rooms were spotless, beds very comfy. Close to CDB pitt st mall, the rocks, circular key and the opera house. Pretty much close to everything you want to see. Its a beautiful building.Breakfast was lovely very good value. Definatly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is just a stones throw away from the Botanic gardens, Woolloomollo, the Opera House and Darling Harbour- perfect!
reviews.title: Perfect location in Sydney without the price tag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel went through a refurb a year or so ago so is really fresh. Great food and a cool cafe across the road that does great breakfasts. I stay here every time I come to Sydney - it rocks!!
reviews.title: superb location in sydney
Fabulous hotel in great location
reviews.text: Great hotel for sightseeing. Central location within walking distance of all major attractions. Very clean and excellent size rooms. Superb pool area- very relaxing after a days walking around the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Radisson Plaza Sydney for two nights on a stop over. Hotel is very centrally located, rooms are spacious and very well decorated, service is friendly and breakfast was good. Our only small complaint was that we asked for a view and got just a building wall.
reviews.title: Central, excellent rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007
reviews.text: We spent a great week in sydney. And we fortunately choose to stay at the radisson plaza.
reviews.title: super staff, super rooms, super location
Loved the bathroom
reviews.text: The check in service was less than great, however this was our only negative. After explaining it was our holiday of a lifetime, we asked if he could asign us a good room. To which his answer was yes, at a cost of $55 dollars a night for a upgrade!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Anyway the room we got was great. No real view but all the amenities we really good. The room was a good size, the bed was comfy. The bathroom was really nice, with a good size bath and a great shower. The hotel has a modern feel and so to are the rooms
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - great service all round.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location. 5 minute walk to circular quay, and other city attractions just a walk away i.e Darling harbour.
reviews.title: Great Location - stylish
Standard 4* stuff
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in July at a budget rate with breakfast included. Nice quick check-in with friendly staff. Room is nice and big although I was a bit shocked to see that my king sized bed was just 2 singles stuck together!!! I'm not sure if this is the norm these days.. but i certainly expected a proper king!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Clean room and Bathroom. Powerful shower. Comfortable stay.. nice and quiet.
reviews.title: Brilliant helpful staff and excellant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast was nice.. like the chef who cooks you up an omelette or poached/fried eggs every morning. Gets sickening after 4 mornings.. .but good enough. Can't believe they even have chinese porridge there!!
reviews.title: Good Value and Position

likes.disliked: — Expensive car parking and ordinary cafe restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: On the whole... it's a standard no-nonsense hotel. Nothing extraordinary... but then nothing bad. Area is nicely located about 10 mins walk from the main circular quay terminal (transport hub to all major attractions) so no complaints there.
reviews.title: Not a hotel if you are on a business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Solid... just nothing special.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — too much furniture in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Firstly you do not stay at this hotel for the views - I had an inner courtyard view, and even if you have an outside room, you wil have a view of a busy street.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: But the location is great - 5 minutes walk to Circular Quay, the Botantic Gardens, Hyde Park, Wynyard and the Pitt Street Mall. You can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: Room was not out of this world but was comfortable, clean and very functional. Bathroom was nice - powerful good showers, deep baths and nice toiletries in the room too.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service good - for some reason I'd been booked into a smoking room but moving me to a non-smoker was no problem at all. Staff were courteous whenever I encountered them, and maid service in the room was good.
reviews.title: A real gem!

likes.liked: — Large rooms, Fantastic beds, Friendly & helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't bother with the restaurants - usual hotel prices for drinks and breakfast. I wandered over to the Capri Cafe in the Menzies Arcade by Wynyard Station every morning for a freshly cooked fry up every morning for A$10!!
reviews.title: ambience and modern newness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights on our first visit to Australia and it did not disappoint in any way. The staff and service were very good and the room was well equipped and very clean. The view was as good as you could expect from a city centre hotel and the location was very good for walking to the harbour bridge, Rocks and shopping arcades near Pitt Street. We had breakfast in our room on the first morning which was very good, but we didn't eat in the hotel after that as it is a bit expensive and there were plenty of eating places elsewhere. During the day there are food courts among the shopping centres with a huge selection of meals, which don't seem to get a mention in the guide books. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After alot of deliberating over a few Sydney Hotels, we decided to go with the cheaper 5 star option and book the Radisson Plaza and spend the difference on ourselves (Lunch at Aria).
reviews.title: Great Position....Awsome Staff, They couldn't do enough to help.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: When we arrived we weren't expecting too much, The Hotel is an Old Landmark Building that has been transformed and is in a brilliant location, close to Circular Quay, The Rocks, Opera House and lots of other attractions.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Lovely Old Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When we arrived, we were greeted and shown to our room very promptly and told that if we had any questions or requests, not to hesitate to ask. As we had tickets to see Wicked the musical, i thought I'd go down to reception and find out the best way to get there and also ask about some of the weekend markets that Sydney has.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but didn't think it was 5 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately I don't remember the staff members name that served me but he was fantastic, he gave me a map and pointed me into the right direction, served us with a smile every time we passed and he seemed to be genuinely interested in how our trip was going (He even gave us a complimentary wicked cd and program)
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was faultless, the breakfast every morning was delicious, the chef even remembered what my partners omelete was after the fist morning and with nothing more than a smile he started cooking it when we entered.
reviews.title: Good hotel, better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions.
reviews.title: great hotel in a central CBD location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good location, clean and quiet room (the iPod dock is a nice touch), 24 hr business centre with free internet access, and nice gym.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is situated nicely in the city centre, roughly five minutes’ walk to the Circular Quay area for sight of the famous Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Shopping is also nearby up Pitt Street.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location
Hospitality No 1 at Radisson Plaza
reviews.text: Check-in was smooth and handled very courteously. Having arrived tired at 8.30am off a flight from Singapore, Assistant Front Desk Manager Ben Mellor kindly allocated us an available room on the executive floor, so thumbs up to him and to Radisson flexibility. The room was spacious and the bathroom bright, spotlessly clean, and well stocked with the usual toiletries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The health spa area was very pleasant, comprising a 10m pool which is about two lanes wide, a Jacuzzi and a steam room. Complimentary towels were provided.
reviews.title: Excellent option in the center of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, and probably the best we’ve had to date in our round-the-world trip. I can’t comment on the hotel’s own restaurant as we chose to eat out in the city. Check out Philip Footes’ bar in George Street near the harbour where you can choose you own steak and cook it on a barbeque. Excellent!
reviews.title: If you're in Sydney, stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having received a good direct room rate for 5 nights I feel this hotel is good value for its class and will stay there when next in Sydney.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, superb staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived with high hopes for our holiday in Sydney, Australia. Being advertised as a boutique, 5 star hotel, we thought we would treat ourselves to a bit of luxury and a room with a view. We paid a little bit extra for it but thought it would be well worth the money. How we were wrong.
reviews.title: Absolute disgrace - avoid like the plague!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception kindly allocated us the wrong room. How disappointed we were to open the doors into a dark and shifty room, only a few floors up and with one small window overlooking the hotel wall. No natural light whatsoever or the 'premier view'. We went down to reception immediately to ask them to check our booking and were hastily told 'you get you pay for'. An upgrade would incur a further 100 pounds a night. We resigned ourselves to the fact that Australian hotels were rubbish.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in great location
Great Central Sydney Hotel
reviews.text: It wasn't until halfway through our stay that my husband had the foresight to double check the hotel literature and realised we HAD been allocated the wrong room. We were finally moved to the correct room on the Saturday night, a great time to have to pack up your belongings and shift. Breakfast was offered by way of compensation but with only a few days left and two early starts, this was a feeble apology and one of which we could barely partake. No financial compensation foer the money we had missed out on by being allocated the wrong and chearper room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: To add insult to injury, the housekeeping is sporadic, the complimentary water and newspaper appears when it feels like it, food orders are inaccurate and expect someone else's bill to be delivered to your room. All in all, a truly 5 star experience.
reviews.title: Falling Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the last time I will be staying at a Radisson. Their customer service is an absolute disgrace.
reviews.title: Nice but small room for money
Fantastic
reviews.text: We stayed in the the Radisson Plaza in January 2007. I had lived in Sydney years ago and went back with my husband for our honeymoon. Needless to say, a good hotel was very important to me as I wanted him to love Australia as much as I had. Unlike our Perth Hotel, the Radisson did not disappoint. We got a very competitive rate on hotels.com and to be honest I couldn't believe the quality of the rooms for the amount we paid. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was the most comfortable in all the hotels we stayed in during our 3 week trip. I'm also a clean freak so I went straight in to check out the bathroom and was so pleased. It was immaculate with a bath, separate shower cublicle and plenty of space.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I knew Sydney well we didn't engage the concierges much, however, they were at all times making efforts to engage us (although not in an annoying way). Insisting on carrying our bags to our rooms (tip not expected) and one morning when we were waiting for a tourbus to arrive to take us to Blue Mountains, the concierge came outside, asked us which tour we were on and rang to see if they were on their way even though we didn't ask him too. The attitude was very much above and beyond. The room service was good and breakfast was excellent although the coffee shop on the corner diagonally opposite the O'Connell St entrance to the hotel is very good and very reasonable. The business centre is also very handy with access to pc's and printers. The location is within 5 mins of circular quay.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will never recommend anywhere else to stay in Sydney.
reviews.title: OK 4star hotel but not particularly memorable.

likes.liked: — location--convenient for Circular Quay and central Sydney
likes.disliked: — Charging policy over New Years Eve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at the Radisson with my husband one saturday night. situated roughly halfway between Circular quay (where the opera house, harbour bridge, the rocks and all must-go touristy places) and Pitt Street shopping area (Myer, David Jones, small boutiques, QVB, Louis vuitton, etc - basically one of the best concentration of shopping in sydney). Its about 5-10 mins walk either way...depending on how fast you walk. Excellent business hotel, apparently quite busy with business people on weekdays. Not surprised as the hotel is surrounded by offices.
reviews.title: Nice plush hotel in the center of the CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were in a standard king room. Room was well appointed with modern decor, excellent lighting, bed was very comfortable...not much of a view though as back to back buildings in the area - this is understable as this was a city hotel. Did not have much interaction with staff as opted to eat in the many excellent restaurants in Sydney. Bathroom was lovely and clean, looked like it was recently refurbished! Im normally very picky and fussy with hotel rooms and amenities but radisson passed with flying colours.
reviews.title: A gem !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location is great, service is good and the rooms are ok (not much view). The hotel is for business people only. Everyone is all in the suits and i have not seen anyone that are here to relax and enjoy. Seems like the staff is used to suits as well and not shorts and t-shirts. Really like the hotel but would consider somewhere with a view the next time.... Free internet is a plus!!
reviews.title: Nice for business, but not for leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are staying here for 5 days as part of a longer trip. The room allocation was very slow at check in and what was promised to be an hour turned out to be two hours but we were given the correct room on the 12th floor. The views are bad from the window. The rooms are quite small but very nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. We requested slippers (to go with the robes in the room), it did take two requests but we got them in the end. We also requested different pillows from the hard ones supplied and these came very quickly. The staff are very polite and helpful. The hotel is a short walk from the Harbour bridge and also from the Opera house with a lovely promenade around the harbour. We are staying on room only and the cost of the breakfast is £20 for continental and £25 for full english which seems quite steep to me. All drinks and food in the hotel are expensive but then this is a 5* hotel so I suppose you expect that. We found a small supermarket opposite where we got bottled water. Tea and coffee are supplied in the room but no fruit or even a complimentary bottle of water which you get in most good hotels these days. When you arrive at Sydney international airport I would advise NOT taking the hotel shuttle bus. The cost was £10 each so I think a taxi would have been cheaper. It was a disaster and a journey of 20 minutes took around an hour and a half. The back of the luggage trailer on the minibus kept opening and luggage was falling out on to the road. We had to stop several times to retrieve luggage which had fallen out. One piece of luggage was never retrieved.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location for sydney opera house and the bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we panicked because all we saw was stairs but there was a wheelchair lift to get up to reception. Check in was quick and easy. The bell boy and concierge were fantastic with the luggage, helping with the wheelchair and parking the car. The room was very big and spacious - lots of room to get around in a wheelchair. The bed was devine and there was a pillow menu to select your desired pillows!! Best sleep ever! Very quiet hotel which was great so we could finally relax on our holiday. The bathroom was a big flat shower room with plenty of space. The toilet could have been a little lower for use with a shower chair. Had a couple of great cocktails at the bar and the barman was only too happy to help us with our desired cxocktails which weren't on the menu! Since it was our anniversary we were pleasantly surprised with a bottle of bubbly and choc covered strawberries the day we arrived. A very nice touch!! Will definately stay here again!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous wheelchair friendly hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very enjoyable stay which was assisted by the great staff member at reception who, as we arrived early (7.00 am) said he will trty and get us a room at around 10.00. At about 10.20 am, we were sitting in the lobby, he called me over adn said the room was ready - fantastic as we had been on the 'red-eye' from Perth, He was good.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was good with great food. Location si excellent just down frfom Goerge street adn the WYnyard Station and close to trhe rocks.
reviews.title: Bright at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Radisson Plaza for 7 nights over New Year with my wife and two teenage daugters .This stylish hotel is in a perfect location being only five minutes walk from circular quay and the main shopping areas .Check-in was fast and efficient and the rooms were very well presented and maintained to a very high standard throughout our stay .All the staff were very freindly and helpful and one staff member deserves particular mention , Lee the young barman was very efficient and engaging and is a real credit to this hotel .I will certainly stay at this very nice hotel on my next stay in this wonderful city
reviews.title: PERFECTLY SITUATED
Awesome
reviews.text: Stayed in Radisson Plaza for two nights. We arrived a little early and our room wasn't ready so they upgraded us without us asking into a supeberb king room. It was lovely, so quiet, spacious, clean etc. Hotel facilities were great too gym, spa, steam room and pool were happily used by us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And can;t get over the location, so near Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, shops, restaurants etc so 10+ for this Hotel will definately stay again
reviews.title: In the CBT but central for everything

likes.disliked: — Nothing at all it was fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in Syd on honeymoon (late twenties). Stayed in club room, liked free canapes and 'champagne' every night (Australian sparkling wine fair enough, still nice).
reviews.title: Just lovely...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Nice hotel, has everything you need, quite small though. Swimming pool is nice but not very wide, only fits a couple of swimmers swimming lengths.
reviews.title: Very impressed with hotel and location

likes.liked: — Clean, modern, quiet, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Vallet parking and good service right from when you enter the hotel makes settling in very easy. Whilst the standard room I stayed in perhaps could've been a little roomier, everything else was of a very high standard. Large and comfortable king size bed, very modern bathroom which somehow manages to fit in a separate bath and shower, and all the other standard amenities. No real views out of my window, unless you like looking at office buildings, but then you don't stay here for the view.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — The high price of internet service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel has a restaurant (which I've heard is very good, but didnt get a chance to eat there), a decent lounge area, health club with sauna, spa, pool, and a business centre.
reviews.title: top class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended if you need to stay in Sydney CBD.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great hotel with a great staff! The location was ideal for business travelers and families. The Opera House was a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There was also a train station about 5 minutes away. The rooms were large and clean. The only downside was the fee for internet service. I paid $50 for just one day. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very happy with the Radisson

description: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel Sydney is an intimate, boutique style, five-star hotel housed within a stunning heritage-listed building and located in the heart of Sydney. The hotel features 362 stylish guest rooms, eight meeting rooms including two with natural light, A superb restaurant, Bistro Fax Restaurant & Bar, a Health Club and complimentary internet access.
